title: Find position vector from velocity vector

content.description: The velocity vector of a particle moving in the xy-plane has components given by <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math>. At time t = 4, the position of the particle is (2, 1).
content.question: What is the y-coordinate of the position vector at time t = 3 ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.6: (BC ONLY) Solving Motion Problems Using Parametric and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
